de.fhb.sailboat.communication
Class CommunicationBase

java.lang.Object
  de.fhb.sailboat.communication.CommunicationBase
Direct Known Subclasses:
CommTCPClient, CommTCPServer
public abstract class CommunicationBase
extends java.lang.Object

The class of the communication component.
It manages and schedules TransmissionModules.
The remote communication takes place over the classes DataOutputStream (sender) and DataInputStream (receiver).
The underlying protocol of the connection has to be implemented in concrete subclasses.

Author:
Michael Kant

Method Detail

registerModule

public boolean registerModule(TransmissionModule tm)
Registers a module to the CommunicationBase, if the max number of registered modules hasn't been reached.
In the process of adding a TransmissionModule, a ModuleWorker is being created that requests data from the associated TransmissionModule within a given interval of milliseconds.
The interval is defined in the TransmissionModule.
If the given interval is 0 or less, then no data will be requested for transmission until explicitly requested.
Receiving incoming data is still possible of course.

Parameters:
tm - The TransmissionModule to be added.
Returns:
True, if the module was added successfully, otherwise False.

requestTransmission

public boolean requestTransmission(TransmissionModule requester)
Instigating an object transmission request on the given TransmissionModule manually.
This is useful for getting a passive TransmissionModule (which got no active transmission cycle) to send data on demand.
It can also be used to instigate a manual object transmission request within an active TransmissionModule outside of its usual transmission cycle.
If the given requester is not reqistered on the CommunicationBase, the method will return false.

Parameters:
requester - The TransmissionModule where to instigate the request.
Returns:
True, if the request was instigated successfully, otherwise false.

setSender

protected void setSender(java.io.DataOutputStream sender)
Setting the sender that shall be used to transmit data.
The sender is supposed to be set by a derived class, which defines the concrete communication protocol.
If no sender was set, the ModuleWorkers of all registered TransmissionModule are going into a sleep state.
If a new sender was set, all ModuleWorkers are being notified and continue their work.

Parameters:
sender - The sender to be used.

setReceiver

protected void setReceiver(java.io.DataInputStream receiver)
Setting the receiver that shall be used to receive data.
The receiver is supposed to be set by a derived class, which defines the concrete communication protocol.
If no receiver was set, internal receive thread of the CommunicationBase is going into a sleep state.
If a new receiver was set, the receive thread is notified and continues its work.

Parameters:
receiver - The receiver to be used.

getSender

public java.io.DataOutputStream getSender()
Getting the used sender.

Returns:
The used sender.

getReceiver

public java.io.DataInputStream getReceiver()
Getting the used receiver.

Returns:
The used receiver.

initialize

public boolean initialize()
Initializes the receive thread that redirects the incoming data to the corresponding TransmissionModules.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Interrupts all ModuleWorkers, removes the registered TransmissionModules and interrupts the internal receive thread.

isConnected

public abstract boolean isConnected()
Checks whether the underlying connection is still active.
This method must be implemented in a derived class, since it's responsible for implementing the concrete connection.

Returns:
True, if the underlying connection is establishes, otherwise False.

closeConnection

public abstract boolean closeConnection()
Causes the underlying connection to be closed.
This method must be implemented in a derived class, since it's responsible for implementing the concrete connection.

Returns:
